title: Oxburgh Hall Walk Route

images.title: William McLaughlin / Oxburgh Hall & Formal Gardens.
images.caption: Oxburgh Hall and Formal Gardens. In the house you can find documents with seals attached from historical figures such as Edward IV, Henry VIII and Elizabeth I. There's also a large piece of needlework credited to Mary, Queen of Scots

images.title: John Salmon [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ruined nave in Oxborough Church

description: This walk visits the Norfolk village of Oxborough and the 15th century moated country house of Oxburgh Hall. The estate includes parkland and woodland with a number of waymarked trails making it ideal for an easy afternoon stroll. In the estate you'll find lovely formal gardens and woodland trails through My Lady's Wood and Home Covert. Look out for water loving wildlife by the pretty stream in My Lady's Wood. To continue your walking in the area head to the delightful Lynford Arboretum. Located near Mundford the site has a number of waymarked footpaths, taking you to pretty lakes and a wide variety of tree species. The arboretum lies on the edge of Thetford Forest where there are miles of trails to try.
